content: I was at the V.A. Hospital today and picked up a copy of the vererans post march 2009. The editorial on page 3 is scary to say the lest. As i read it i just thought its just more of big goverment,but half way down i saw somthing that shocked me. That the president obama is going to get us better healh care. Well surprising but not a shock. what follow did how ever a plan to cut disability benfits by up to 40% and that no-copay veterans will now be asks to pay more out of pocket. I am a disabled veteran and if i loose 40% of my pay i will loose my home. We are now just hanging on. Dose anyone know if this is really true, i very much hope it is not!!
reply: I was at the V.A. Hospital today and picked up a copy of the vererans post march 2009. The editorial on page 3 is scary to say the lest. As i read it i just thought its just more of big goverment,but half way down i saw somthing that shocked me. That the president obama is going to get us better healh care. Well surprising but not a shock. what follow did how ever a plan to cut disability benfits by up to 40% and that no-copay veterans will now be asks to pay more out of pocket. I am a disabled veteran and if i loose 40% of my pay i will loose my home. We are now just hanging on. Dose anyone know if this is really true, i very much hope it is not!!

content: Obama this - Obama that - There's so much crap flying around it not funny. With the way the economy is, and with so many American's not getting proper health care, or are uninsured, here we have a group of people getting almost free care from the VA, and they are still complaining. I have been getting VA healthcare for many years, with co-pays, and I have nly received top-notch care and follow-up care from the VA every time. The amount of my co-pay is a smidgen to what I used to pay when I had private care and co-pays. Dont worry folks, Barack Obama will not be cutting VA healthcare benefits anytime soon, or during in his administration NEVER. "I believe that banking institutions are more dangerous to our liberties than standing armies." - T. Jefferson
reply: Obama this - Obama that - There's so much crap flying around it not funny. title: Obama to cut veteran disablity pay?

content: quote: plan to cut disability benfits by up to 40% The most recent attempt to cut disability benefits that I have been able to find was in 2006. Senate Bill 3521 was proposed by the then Senate Budget Committee Chairman Judd Gregg and co-sponsored by 26 other senators including the then Majority Leader Bill Frist. Nothing I can find more recent than that.
quote: plan to cut disability benfits by up to 40%
reply: The most recent attempt to cut disability benefits that I have been able to find was in 2006. Senate Bill 3521 was proposed by the then Senate Budget Committee Chairman Judd Gregg and co-sponsored by 26 other senators including the then Majority Leader Bill Frist. Nothing I can find more recent than that.

content: To clear things up here is the editorial information. posted in the vererans post march 2009 volume 19, number 3 by Phillip Meshin. editorial name was "We Bet Your're Stimulated Now". Thats all the information i have i can not link it because it is not a internet source.It is from a free paper we have at our V.A hospital in tampa florida.I do not post a lot but i do read most of the forums. This just scared me. I can not work because of server pain i have,we are just making it right now and if we were to lose 40% of my pay we would lose our home. I really do hope the editorial is wrong but that is why i posted here to see if anyone else has heard of this, not to throw stones.To answer ol_doc birther i do not think so. I am a 21 year airforce vertern even thou i am disabled i would do it all over again i a heart beat.I loved my time in the Airforce. I only left the Airforce after i was told i could not deploy with my troops and i made a promise that if there was ever a time i could not do my job i would leave and so i did.
reply: To clear things up here is the editorial information. posted in the vererans post march 2009 volume 19, number 3 by Phillip Meshin. editorial name was "We Bet Your're Stimulated Now". Thats all the information i have i can not link it because it is not a internet source.It is from a free paper we have at our V.A hospital in tampa florida.I do not post a lot but i do read most of the forums. This just scared me. I can not work because of server pain i have,we are just making it right now and if we were to lose 40% of my pay we would lose our home. I really do hope the editorial is wrong but that is why i posted here to see if anyone else has heard of this, not to throw stones.To answer ol_doc birther i do not think so. I am a 21 year airforce vertern even thou i am disabled i would do it all over again i a heart beat.I loved my time in the Airforce. I only left the Airforce after i was told i could not deploy with my troops and i made a promise that if there was ever a time i could not do my job i would leave and so i did.

The amount of my co-pay is a smidgen to what I used to pay when I had private care and co-pays. Dont worry folks, Barack Obama will not be cutting VA healthcare benefits anytime soon, or during in his administration NEVER. He also campaigned against taxing health care benefits, so don't get comfortable in your complacency. Will the antics of Barack Obama bring about the demise of Jack_Flats????????

content: I was at the V.A. Hospital today and picked up a copy of the vererans post march 2009. The editorial on page 3 is scary to say the lest. As i read it i just thought its just more of big goverment,but half way down i saw somthing that shocked me. That the president obama is going to get us better healh care. Well surprising but not a shock. what follow did how ever a plan to cut disability benfits by up to 40% and that no-copay veterans will now be asks to pay more out of pocket. I am a disabled veteran and if i loose 40% of my pay i will loose my home. We are now just hanging on. Dose anyone know if this is really true, i very much hope it is not!!

content: To clear things up here is the editorial information. posted in the vererans post march 2009 volume 19, number 3 by Phillip Meshin. editorial name was "We Bet Your're Stimulated Now". Thats all the information i have i can not link it because it is not a internet source.It is from a free paper we have at our V.A hospital in tampa florida.I do not post a lot but i do read most of the forums. This just scared me. I can not work because of server pain i have,we are just making it right now and if we were to lose 40% of my pay we would lose our home. I really do hope the editorial is wrong but that is why i posted here to see if anyone else has heard of this, not to throw stones.To answer ol_doc birther i do not think so. I am a 21 year airforce vertern even thou i am disabled i would do it all over again i a heart beat.I loved my time in the Airforce. I only left the Airforce after i was told i could not deploy with my troops and i made a promise that if there was ever a time i could not do my job i would leave and so i did.

This just scared me. I can not work because of server pain i have,we are just making it right now and if we were to lose 40% of my pay we would lose our home. I really do hope the editorial is wrong but that is why i posted here to see if anyone else has heard of this, not to throw stones.To answer ol_doc birther i do not think so. I am a 21 year airforce vertern even thou i am disabled i would do it all over again i a heart beat.I loved my time in the Airforce. I only left the Airforce after i was told i could not deploy with my troops and i made a promise that if there was ever a time i could not do my job i would leave and so i did.
title: Obama to cut veteran disablity pay?

content: quote: Originally posted by jack_flats: Obama this - Obama that - There's so much crap flying around it not funny. With the way the economy is, and with so many American's not getting proper health care, or are uninsured, here we have a group of people getting almost free care from the VA, and they are still complaining. I have been getting VA healthcare for many years, with co-pays, and I have nly received top-notch care and follow-up care from the VA every time. The amount of my co-pay is a smidgen to what I used to pay when I had private care and co-pays. Dont worry folks, Barack Obama will not be cutting VA healthcare benefits anytime soon, or during in his administration NEVER. ....never say never, but the rest of your post is very true Already past the future
